result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dyrell Tony Minor

records.addlTxt: COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a calendar call. Defense was unable to contact their client. State requests a warrant to be issued.
Court ordered bench warrant issued, remand to Commissioner, and no action on bail.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Calendar call scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Dyrell Tony Minor
Current: 3509 W DOUGLAS AVE, Milwaukee, WI 53209 United States  (Effective: 05-25-2022)
Prior: 2936 West Highland Boulevard #105, Milwaukee, WI 53208

Defendant Dyrell Tony Minor in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dyrell Tony Minor appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests status conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dyrell Tony Minor in court.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/29/2022@02:30pm
